name: Slane Irish Whiskey
description:
Triple-casked Irish whiskey from the legendary grounds of Slane Castle, home to the Conyngham family. This blended whiskey is matured in three types of casks—virgin oak, seasoned whiskey, and sherry casks—creating a complex and smooth character. Distilled on the banks of the River Boyne, Slane Irish Whiskey represents a modern take on traditional Irish whiskey craftsmanship.

Spirit Profile

Aroma: Vanilla, toasted oak, and subtle spice

Palate: Smooth and approachable with notes of caramel, honey, and dried fruit with a gentle warmth. The triple cask maturation adds layers of complexity.

Finish: Smooth and lingering with hints of oak and sweetness

Style: Triple-casked Irish whiskey; modern take on traditional craftsmanship

Best For: Neat, on the rocks, or in classic cocktails like an Irish coffee or whiskey sour

Food Pairing

Enjoy neat, on the rocks, or in classic cocktails. Pairs well with dark chocolate, aged cheeses, or as an after-dinner digestif. Excellent in an Irish coffee or whiskey sour.
tasteProfile: vanilla, toasted oak, caramel, honey, smooth
foodPairing: Dark chocolate, aged cheeses, cocktails

name: Giffard Limoncello
description:
Available in different varieties - prices may differ

Description

Premium French limoncello crafted with lemon zest since 1885. Giffard's traditional recipe uses the finest lemon zest to create a vibrant, authentic Italian-style liqueur. This artisanal limoncello captures the essence of fresh lemons with a perfect balance of sweetness and citrus brightness.

Spirit Profile

Aroma: Intense lemon aromas with vibrant citrus character

Palate: Fresh and zesty with natural lemon flavor and balanced sweetness

Finish: Clean and refreshing with authentic, vibrant character

Style: Premium French limoncello; artisanal Italian-style liqueur

Best For: Chilled as a digestif, over ice, in cocktails, or drizzled over desserts

Food Pairing

Perfect served chilled as a digestif or over ice. Excellent in cocktails, drizzled over ice cream, or paired with fresh fruit. Ideal for summer sipping or as a refreshing aperitif.

Also available: Giffard Apricot Liqueur, Giffard Crème de Cacao - prices may differ.
tasteProfile: lemon zest, fresh, zesty, sweet, refreshing
foodPairing: Ice cream, fresh fruit, cocktails

name: Giffard Crème de Cacao 1885
description:
Available in different varieties - prices may differ

Description

Premium French crème de cacao crafted since 1885. Giffard's traditional recipe uses the finest cacao to create a rich, chocolate-flavored liqueur. This artisanal liqueur captures the essence of premium chocolate with a perfect balance of sweetness and depth.

Spirit Profile

Aroma: Rich chocolate aromas with vanilla notes

Palate: Smooth and luxurious with notes of dark chocolate, vanilla, and sweet spices. Well-balanced sweetness.

Finish: Long and satisfying

Style: Premium French crème de cacao; artisanal since 1885

Best For: Neat, on the rocks, in cocktails, or drizzled over desserts

Food Pairing

Perfect served neat, on the rocks, or in cocktails. Pairs beautifully with desserts, particularly chocolate or coffee-based treats. Also excellent drizzled over ice cream or mixed with coffee.

Also available: Giffard Limoncello, Giffard Apricot Liqueur - prices may differ.
foodPairing: Desserts, chocolate, coffee, cocktails

name: Absolut Vodka
description:
Available in different varieties - prices may differ

Description

Swedish vodka made with winter wheat and pure water from the village of Åhus. Absolut has been crafted since 1879 using a continuous distillation process. Made with Swedish water and winter wheat, this premium vodka is known for its exceptional purity and smooth character.

Spirit Profile

Aroma: Clean and neutral with subtle grain notes

Palate: Smooth and velvety with exceptional purity and no harshness

Finish: Clean and crisp

Style: Premium Swedish vodka; continuous distillation since 1879

Best For: Cocktails (martinis, cosmopolitans, vodka tonics), neat, or on the rocks

Food Pairing

Versatile in cocktails—perfect for martinis, cosmopolitans, or vodka tonics. Also excellent neat or on the rocks. Pairs well with caviar, smoked salmon, or pickled herring.

Also available: Absolut Citron (Lemon), Absolut Raspberry - prices may differ.

name: Clonakilty Galley Head Irish Whiskey
description:
Available in different varieties - prices may differ

Description

Single pot still Irish whiskey from Clonakilty Atlantic Distillery, distilled from barley grown on the family farm by the edge of the Atlantic Ocean. This coastal whiskey captures the maritime character of its unique location, creating a distinctive expression of Irish whiskey tradition.

Spirit Profile

Aroma: Maritime salt, fresh barley, and gentle spice with coastal influences

Palate: Smooth and approachable with notes of honey, vanilla, and toasted grains with a subtle briny character

Finish: Clean and coastal

Food Pairing

Enjoy neat or with a drop of water to release the aromas. Pairs beautifully with fresh seafood, particularly oysters or smoked salmon. Also excellent with Irish cheeses or dark chocolate.

Also available: Clonakilty Single Pot Still, Clonakilty Double Oak Cask, Clonakilty Port Cask, Clonakilty Cask Finish Series - prices may differ.

name: Maker's Mark Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whisky
description:
Handmade bourbon since 1953, crafted at Star Hill Farm in Loretto, Kentucky. Maker's Mark is known for its signature red wax seal and smooth, approachable character. Made with soft red winter wheat instead of rye, creating a uniquely smooth and mellow bourbon.

Spirit Profile

Aroma: Vanilla, caramel, and oak

Palate: Smooth and mellow with notes of toffee, honey, and gentle spice. The wheat-based mash bill creates exceptional smoothness.

Finish: Long and warm

Style: Handmade Kentucky straight bourbon; wheat-based mash bill for smoothness

Best For: Neat, on the rocks, or in classic bourbon cocktails like an Old Fashioned or Manhattan

Food Pairing

Perfect neat, on the rocks, or in classic bourbon cocktails. Pairs well with grilled meats, barbecue, or dark chocolate. Excellent in an Old Fashioned or Manhattan.

Spirit Profile

Aroma: Complex aromas of dried fruit, vanilla, and floral notes

Palate: Smooth and elegant with flavors of apricot, honey, and toasted oak

Finish: Long and warming with hints of spice and dried fruit

Style: Premium cognac V.S.O.P; Grande and Petite Champagne regions

Best For: Neat, with a single ice cube, or in cocktails like a Sidecar or French 75

Food Pairing

Traditionally enjoyed as a digestif, neat or with a single ice cube. Pairs beautifully with dark chocolate, foie gras, or blue cheese. Also excellent in cocktails like a Sidecar or French 75.

Available in different varieties - prices may differ

Language of Wine

Food Pairing

Language of Wine

Ruby: Deep ruby red with vibrant fruit aromas. Rich and fruity on the palate with notes of berries, cherries, and sweet spice. Well-balanced sweetness with a smooth, lingering finish.

Tawny: Rich amber-tawny color with aromas of dried fruit, nuts, and caramel. Smooth and elegant on the palate with notes of figs, raisins, and toasted almonds. Well-balanced sweetness with a long, satisfying finish.

Food Pairing

Ruby: Perfect served chilled as an aperitif or dessert wine. Pairs beautifully with dark chocolate, blue cheese, or fresh berries.

Tawny: Perfect served slightly chilled or at room temperature. Pairs beautifully with blue cheese, dark chocolate, or nuts. Also excellent as a dessert wine or after-dinner digestif.

name: Kopke 10 Year Old Tawny Porto
description:
Aged 10 years in wood, this tawny port from Kopke represents exceptional quality in Portuguese fortified wine. Matured in oak casks, this port develops rich, complex flavors with notes of dried fruit, nuts, and caramel. Kopke is one of the oldest port houses, established in 1638.

Language of Wine

Rich amber-tawny color with aromas of dried fruit, nuts, and caramel. Smooth and elegant on the palate with notes of figs, raisins, and toasted almonds. Well-balanced sweetness with a long, satisfying finish.

Food Pairing

Perfect served slightly chilled or at room temperature. Pairs beautifully with blue cheese, dark chocolate, or nuts. Also excellent as a dessert wine or after-dinner digestif.
tasteProfile: dried fruit, nuts, caramel, figs, elegant
foodPairing: Blue cheese, dark chocolate, nuts, dessert

description:
A distinctive blend of Palomino and Pedro Ximénez grapes aged in oak casks. A Winter's Tale by Williams & Humbert, established in 1877, offers a medium sweet sherry that's perfect for any season. This unique blend combines the best of both grape varieties, creating a balanced and flavorful sherry.

Language of Wine

Rich amber color with aromas of dried fruit, nuts, and sweet spices. Medium sweet on the palate with notes of raisins, figs, and caramel. Well-balanced with a smooth, lingering finish.

Food Pairing

Best served chilled or on the rocks. Pairs beautifully with desserts, particularly chocolate or fruit-based treats. Also excellent as an aperitif or after-dinner drink.
tasteProfile: dried fruit, raisins, figs, caramel, medium sweet
foodPairing: Desserts, chocolate, fruit, aperitif

description:

Language of Wine

Food Pairing

Perfect served at room temperature or slightly chilled. Pairs beautifully with blue cheese, dark chocolate, or rich desserts. Also excellent on its own as an after-dinner digestif.
tasteProfile: dark fruit, spice, chocolate, blackberries, full-bodied
foodPairing: Blue cheese, dark chocolate, rich desserts
